beans.description:
This (contrived) adaptor does the following...
* reads lines from file named via a system property. * writes to file named in a properties file "example.properties"
It is designed to illustrate using system properties and property files with SpringAdaptor.
In this example SpringAdaptor will automatically add a PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer to the spring context. This is set to substitute with system properties and with properties defined in any resource specified with a "-props" flag.
Run it like this...
java -Dinput=input/input.txt org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config autoconfigure.xml -bean Adaptor -props example.properties
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar
Once it is running it will read from the input file and write to the output
